definition: to ladle water/to scoop up water

sentences.english: The sectarian thinks that he has the sea ladled into his private pond.
sentences.chinese: 自私偏狹者以爲他能將滄海之水全部舀進自己的池塘。

sentences.english: I quickly scooped up another ravioli and popped it in my mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我飛快地舀起一個餛飩，放進嘴裏。

sentences.english: Place a rounded tablespoonful of filling in lower right corner of strip.
sentences.chinese: 舀滿滿一湯匙的餡倒在麪皮的右下角處。

sentences.english: She dipped ice cream from a container.
So the bowl won't move around and it's easier to scoop up the rice with your spoon.
sentences.chinese: 這樣碗就不會動來動去，你用勺子舀飯就會比較容易。

sentences.english: Sewn scoop neckline, armholes and hem.
sentences.chinese: 舀縫製的領口，袖孔和下襬。

sentences.english: Using a slotted spoon, carefully lift the fish rolls onto a warmed serving platter.
sentences.chinese: 用大漏勺將魚卷小心地舀起放入加熱過的食物盤中。

sentences.english: She scooped out the yeasty sediments.
sentences.chinese: 她將發酵的沉澱物舀了出來。

sentences.english: Don't scoop up too much with your spoon.
sentences.chinese: 每次用勺子舀得少一點，別舀那麼多。

sentences.english: Don't scoop up too much with your spoon.
sentences.chinese: 每次用勺子舀得少一點，別舀那麼多。

sentences.english: Put the Tiramisu glass on a plate, and spoon mango cubes on side. Serve.
sentences.chinese: 將提拉米蘇放到盤中，在盤子的邊上舀上芒果塊。

sentences.english: Spoon scrambled eggs atop toasts. Sprinkle with more fleur de sel and pepper.
sentences.chinese: 將炒好的雞蛋舀在麪包片上，撒上鹽和胡椒。

sentences.english: Our boat will sink unless we bail (out).
sentences.chinese: 除非我們把船艙裏的水舀出去，否則我們的船要下沉。

sentences.english: The hostess spooned out some soup to each of the guests.
sentences.chinese: 女主人爲每位客人舀了些湯。

sentences.english: He dipped a cup in the wine bowl and held it up.
sentences.chinese: 他在酒缸裏舀了一杯，舉起杯子。

sentences.english: So, I just scoop it without aerating the flour first.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我只是沒有充氣舀麪粉首先它。

definition: spoon/ladle/CL:把[ba3]/abbr. for 公勺[gong1 shao2], centiliter (unit of volume)
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
